sentence.Network_en: He did that to gratify his girlfriend's vanity.
sentence.Network_cn: 他做那事是要满足他女友的虚荣心.

sentence.Network_en: I do not think that young and amiable poets are bound to gratify its taste.
sentence.Network_cn: 我认为和善的青年诗人没有义务满足它的胃口.

sentence.Network_en: She dilated on the beauty of the park and the Hall to gratify him.
sentence.Network_cn: 她不断地夸奖园林和府第的美丽,让他高兴.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... ingratiating a 讨好的，诌媚的 gratify v 使满足；喜悦 gratification n 满足；喜悦.
以g开头的英语英文单词 ... gratification 满足，喜悦 gratify 使高兴，使满足 gratifying 可喜的.
综合英语单词表(第二册下) - 豆丁网 ... gloomily ad. 阴郁地 gratify v. 使满足，使满意 gratitude n. 感激.
Lesson 46 Hobbies 业余爱好... ... trifling adj. 微小的 gratify v. 便满意 caprice n. 任性.

list.abs: 体育项目的英语怎么说 ... 增强体质 to strengthen one's physique 可喜的，令人满意的 gratifying 称号，绰号 label.
体育项目的英语怎么说 ... 增强体质 to strengthen one's physique 可喜的，令人满意的 gratifying 称号，绰号 label.
欣_百度百科 ... 6. 欣赏[ admire；appreciate；enjoy；take pleasure in] 7. 欣慰[ be gratified] 8. 欣悉[ be glad to learn].

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'make pleasing'): from French gratifier or Latin gratificari 'give or do as a favour', from gratus 'pleasing, thankful'

entry.def: If you are gratified by something, it gives you pleasure or satisfaction.

example.ex: Mr. Dambar was gratified by his response.
example.tran: 丹巴尔先生对他的回答感到满意。

entry.def: If you gratify your own or another person's desire, you do what is necessary to please yourself or them.

example.tran: 我们满足了朋友的好奇心。
每一个突发的念头都会得到满足。

auth_sentence.content: The...servants of the crown...distressed their private fortunes to gratify their sovereign.
auth_sentence.res_content: The...servants of the crown...distressed their private fortunes to gratify their sovereign.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The...servants of the crown...distressed their private fortunes to gratify their sovereign.

auth_sentence.content: The result, slimy with implausible plotting, will gratify those who consider all politics to be a conspiratorial murk.
auth_sentence.res_content: The result, slimy with implausible plotting, will gratify those who consider all politics to be a conspiratorial murk.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The result, slimy with implausible plotting, will gratify those who consider all politics to be a conspiratorial murk.

stems_affixes.word_buile: grate=grat感激,高兴+ful充满……的→adj.[to,for]感激的;感谢的
gratuity[[n.赏钱,小费]]涔吹腫给小费可多可少]→所以"无缘无故"的
ingratiate[v.逢迎,讨好]+ing……的→adj.讨好的,谄媚的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 优美,文雅;恩惠,恩泽;宽限,缓刑;感恩祷告
stems_affixes.word_buile: grace=grat感激,高兴→感激别人态度一定好,所以grace有了"文雅"的意义
grat感激,高兴+itude状态→n.感激,感谢
grat感激,高兴+uity=ity表名词→因感激而给小钱,小费
in不+grat感激,高兴+e→不感谢→忘恩负义

stems_affixes.value_cn: 祝贺, 庆贺, 恭喜
stems_affixes.word_buile: con共同+gratulate[v.欢迎, 祝]→v.祝贺, 庆贺, 恭喜
grat感激,高兴+ify使……→使[人]满足,高兴
grat感激,高兴+ulate→让[别人]高兴→祝贺
in使……+grat感激,高兴+iate表动词→使别人高兴→讨好

sentences.en: It gratified me to know that she would soon be well again.
sentences.cn: 得知她将很快就恢复健康, 使我十分高兴。

sentences.en: We were gratified to learn that you had passed the examination.
sentences.cn: 获悉你已通过考试我们很高兴。
